Package frc.robot.subsystems

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.robot.subsystems.Drivetrain
  • public class Drivetrain
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the code for the robot drivetrain. It initializes motor controllers and has methods for various functions of the drivetrain.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void arcadeDrive​(double speed)
      Maps joysticks to the drivetrain for Arcade layout
      void driveArc​(double rightInitial, double leftInitial, double rightInches, double leftInches, double rightPower, double leftPower)
      drives in an arc loosely adapted from 2018-robot
      void driveStraight​(double targetDist, double startPower, double endPower)
      drives straight using a P controller
      double getAveragePosition()
      gets the average encoder position of the drivetrain
      double getCurrentDistance()
      returns the current distance traversed relative to the initial distance
      static Drivetrain getInstance()
      creates a new instance of the drivetrain class if one has not been made
      double getLeftPosition()
      gets the left side primary motor's encoder position
      double getRightPosition()
      gets the right side primary motor's encoder position
      void resetEncoderPositions()
      resets both of the encoder positions
      void resetInitialDistance()
      resets the initial distance used by driveStraight()
      void setLeftSpeed​(double speed)
      Sets the left speed of the drivetrain
      void setRightSpeed​(double speed)
      Sets the right side speed of the drivetrain.
      void setSpeed​(double leftSpeed, double rightSpeed)
      Sets the speed of both the control groups
      java.lang.String toString()

      • getInstance

        public static Drivetrain getInstance()
        creates a new instance of the drivetrain class if one has not been made
        Returns:
        an instance of the drivetrain class

      • setLeftSpeed

        public void setLeftSpeed​(double speed)
        Sets the left speed of the drivetrain
        Parameters:
        speed - tbe speed to set from -1 to 1

      • setRightSpeed

        public void setRightSpeed​(double speed)
        Sets the right side speed of the drivetrain.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed to set to from -1 to 1

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive​(double speed)
        Maps joysticks to the drivetrain for Arcade layout
        Parameters:
        speed - scaling factor for robot speed

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed​(double leftSpeed,
                     double rightSpeed)
        Sets the speed of both the control groups
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - speed of the left side of the drivetrain from -1 to 1
        rightSpeed - speed of the right side of the drivetrain from -1 to 1

      • driveStraight

        public void driveStraight​(double targetDist,
                          double startPower,
                          double endPower)
        drives straight using a P controller
        Parameters:
        targetDist - the distance you want the robot to travel
        startPower - the starting power
        endPower - the ending power

      • resetInitialDistance

        public void resetInitialDistance()
        resets the initial distance used by driveStraight()

      • getCurrentDistance

        public double getCurrentDistance()
        returns the current distance traversed relative to the initial distance

      • driveArc

        public void driveArc​(double rightInitial,
                     double leftInitial,
                     double rightInches,
                     double leftInches,
                     double rightPower,
                     double leftPower)
        drives in an arc loosely adapted from 2018-robot
        Parameters:
        rightInitial - the current (at the beginning of driveArc) drivetrain position for the right side
        leftInitial - the current (at the beginning of driveArc) drivetrain position for the left side
        rightInches - the number of inches to move the right side of the drivetrain
        leftInches - the number of inches to move the left side of the drivetrain
        rightPower - the power to set the right side of the drivetrain to
        leftPower - the power to set the left side of the drivetrain to

      • getRightPosition

        public double getRightPosition()
        gets the right side primary motor's encoder position
        Returns:
        right encoder position

      • getLeftPosition

        public double getLeftPosition()
        gets the left side primary motor's encoder position
        Returns:
        left encoder position

      • getAveragePosition

        public double getAveragePosition()
        gets the average encoder position of the drivetrain
        Returns:
        average encoder position

      • resetEncoderPositions

        public void resetEncoderPositions()
        resets both of the encoder positions

        Overrides:
